intro: Steiractinia, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring showy, often brightly colored petals and a specialized lip that aids in pollination. The plants typically grow in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Steiractinia species are native to regions such as South America, Africa, and parts of Asia. Their botanical significance lies in their role in ecological systems and their value in horticultural cultivation.
